channel.title: Something Soon
channel.description:
This is an excerpt from a brief conversation I had with Nathan "NateDGreat" Ayres. He invited me to post this to the forums, so here ya go.
He's referring to his post about spaghetti o's in this... [quote] It was mean to be a combination of whatever you wanted it to be haha. If you saw a release date in it.. well there may be some truth there. If you saw me telling people to simply go away until the end of 2010, well there may have been some truth there too haha. It wasn't supposed to be some form of coded message or cryptic secret awaiting the combined might of the Black Mesa fanbase to unlock. It was a spontaneous shot across the bow that went much further then I expected it to go.
However, lest you despair, let me just say this. There will be a break in silence, of some form, from us at the end of 2010/very early 2011. Will it be a mod release? Another trailer? A media release? A Twitter update? A new release date? Raminator changing his avatar? Or just an announcement saying "oh hai believe it or not we're still alive"? I can't say. But an end of 2010 update.. you can be sure will happen. [/quote] Discuss.

Such entertainment here. Awesome, I never get bored of this forum.

item.title: Something Soon
item.dc:creator: striker
item.description:
Garfuncle:

I for one, am optimistic.

Hoping for a December release.

I still think, the mod is already finished, they’re only waiting for Christmas, so that everybody in the world gets an extraordinary present

flyaway888:

…they are not waste time with spammers and trolls on the forum, a well-organized team is able to make a project like BM in less than 5 years…4 years and 10 months…because they have the resources already It takes only one month to port the mod from a version of source to another…this is not a problem

I recon you know that from the last time you ported HL1 to source.

Read full topic

item.title: Something Soon
item.dc:creator: flyaway888
item.description:
Maxey:

We’re only going through the “pain” of waiting for BM because we chose to.

As a free mod, no one is being owed anything and the devs don’t have to feel like they’re doing people a necessary service.

If you feel outraged because an irrelevant piece of software is not coming out sooner than later, then you need better priorities in life.

You misunderstood me, it’s not the problem that it takes to long it’s about the devs because there are not serious…they said they will release in 2009 I understood from 1 jan 2005 to 31 dec 2009 4 years ok, BM will make a 2010 release for sure this time…another blur after whole 5 years (sufficient time for any type of project) BM is not done! for valve it took 6 years for HL2 because they worked to make Steam and Source engine and don’t tell me that they haven’t time just because they work only in their spare time take a look on another dev team…and how they are organized…they are not waste time with spammers and trolls on the forum, a well-organized team is able to make a project like BM in less than 5 years…4 years and 10 months…because they have the resources already It takes only one month to port the mod from a version of source to another…this is not a problem

Read full topic

item.title: Something Soon
item.dc:creator: antisuck
item.description:
theledge:

a .7z-file inside a rar file and another rar and another, that’s 4 layers! It would take 10 years to unpack!

Redtarget:

Fucking Inception!

And the events of HL2 were all just a dream that took place while in stasis on the tram back from Xen (assuming you chose correctly)!!! And Episode 1 was merely another level of dream that takes place in the split second between the explosion of the Citadel and actually being blown to smithereens! Etc and etc!!!

And best of all, that means these years of waiting for BM to be finished and released really only took a fraction of a second of tram-sleep in the original Half-life layer of reality, while the credits rolled, leading one to the inescapable conclusion that not only has there been no delay worth all the whining but the BM dev team will have shattered all records of game development time! Imagine, a fully realized remake of one of the most influential games of all time in an updated engine with new art and audio and some new 3D assets conceived and released in microseconds!!!

Unfortunately I suspect that the final unpacking of the innermost .7z file will be the initial “kick” that sends us all spiraling down a chasm of nested realities: the train crashing, the citadel exploding, the g-man adjusting his tie, the credits rolling, and we will all awaken in 1998, checking the temps on our overclocked celerons.

And the credits end, and the CD in the drive stops spinning.

Or does it…?

Read full topic
